title: High-speed chase
name: High-speed chase
description: An 18-year-old man rammed a police vehicle and eluded police for miles early Wednesday in a chase covering two counties that reached speeds of more than 100 mph and sent one officer to the hospital with minor injuries, police said.

properties.name: 1. McDonald's, 4818 S. Manhattan Ave.
properties.description: At 1:07 a.m., police said Nathan Jaron Johnson was found passed out behind the wheel of his green 2002 Chevrolet Cavalier in the McDonald's drive-thru lane. The engine was running. Officers woke him up, but he refused to get out of the car. He backed up and out of the lane, injuring Officers Eric Book.

properties.name: 2. Pearl Avenue and Westshore Boulevard
properties.description: Officers lost the vehicle after it left McDonalds, but they spotted it going west on Pearl Avenue and then north on Westshore Boulevard.

properties.name: 3. Gandy Boulevard and Manhattan Avenue
properties.description: Two other officers tried to box Johnson's vehicle in at Gandy and Manhattan. He rammed Officer Book's vehicle and sped away, going the wrong way in the eastbound lanes of Gandy. He later got in the westbound lanes.

properties.name: 4. Chase route
properties.description: Police followed Johnson west over the Gandy Bridge and then north on Fourth Street in St. Petersburg. The chase reached speeds of more than 100 mph, police said.

properties.name: 5. I-275 ramp
properties.description: Police said Johnson slowed to exit onto Interstate 275. Officer Gary Garboski used a "PIT maneuver," also known as the precision or pursuit immobilization technique, and struck the vehicle in the rear. Johnson struck a light pole and was taken to Bayfront Medical Center with minor injuries.
